title: Shooting that left 2 young boys dead angers mayor, neighborhood
content:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -
An overnight shooting on the city’s east side has left two boys dead and sent a teenage girl to the hospital.
Police say that they responded to reports of a shooting in the 5700 block of College Ave. shortly before 2 a.m. Saturday.
When they arrived, they found three victims all under the age of 16. Two victims, an 8- and 9-year-old boy, died from their injuries. The other victim, a 16-year-old girl is in an area hospital.
The latest tragedy leaving two kids dead angered the neighborhood and Kansas City Mayor Sly James.
"I'm tired of hearing about kids getting killed," James said. "We have bad combinations of things converging. People who don't know how to solve problems without violence. And they have easy access to the instruments of destruction."
Rosilyn Temple, an integral part of Mothers in Charge anti-violence advocacy group, knows the family.
"I want my community to speak out," Temple said. "We got to step up and get them off of our streets. This is a monster."
Antonio Reese and others on the block woke up to police cars and first responders.
"Come to find out, it was kids my little cousin played with," Reese said.
A different man, who did not want to be identified on camera, said another child in the house ran to his home and asked him to dial 911.
Since October 2014, at least 15 children under the age of 16 have been murdered in the Kansas City metro area.
"It's sad man," Reese said. "Stuff's getting old. These kids deserve to see another day."
Police say that they do not have any suspect information at this time. They ask if you know anything about this crime to please call the TIPS Hotline at 816-474-8477.
